creator: vicentesalvador@netscape.net
text:
When JASPER throws an exception I can see this message:

org.apache.jasper.JasperException: No se puede compilar la clase para JSPNote:
sun.tools.javac.Main has been deprecated.

Meens this that sun.tools.javac.Main has been deprecated on JDK 1.4 beta 2?

creator: craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
text:
It is true that this compiler entry point has been deprecated, but it has not
yet been removed (although this was threatened).

Switching to the internal entry point for the "new" compiler is straightforward,
but it will have negative performance impacts, because we will have to
synchronize and allow only one Java compile at a time. :-(

creator: craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
text:
Because of the potential negative performance impacts of switching to the
non-deprecated compiler entry point, dealing with this issue is being deferred
until a later release.  The JDK 1.4 release group has committed that the old
compiler entry point will *not* be removed in JDK 1.4 final, so the pressure to
deal with this immediately is off.

Jasper 2 (included in 4.1.3 Beta) uses Ant 1.5 to compile, so it doesn't have
that limitation anymore.
